title: Citi's Back to School Drive Delivers Thousands of Supplies to Irving Students
summary: Irving, Texas - Citi today announced that its annual "Back to School Supply Drive" collected more than 9,300 items for Irving-area students, including backpacks, notebooks, pens and pencils. In addition, Citi presented the Irving School Foundation with $20,000 to help provide school uniforms to students in need.
tag-1: Citi's Back to School Drive Delivers Thousands of Supplies to Irving Students
tag-3: Irving, Texas – Citi today announced that its annual "Back to School Supply Drive" collected more than 9,300 items for Irving-area students, including backpacks, notebooks, pens and pencils. In addition, Citi presented the Irving School Foundation with $20,000 to help provide school uniforms to students in need.
tag-4: Citi employees from its Las Colinas and Regent campuses rallied together during the July 18 to Aug. 3 drive, delivering an all-time-high number of supplies to the Irving Independent School District. Citi officially announced the results of the supply drive at its Irving Las Colinas campus, where it also presented the check to the Irving School Foundation. During the event, Citi volunteers packed supplies into a school bus to be delivered to local schools.
tag-5: "Citi is proud to support the Irving School Foundation and Irving students as they prepare to continue their education later this month," said Rodney Phelps, site president of Citi's Irving-based campuses. "Irving can always count on the support of Citi's employees to give back to those in need, and the tremendous success of this year's Back to School drive is a testament to our commitment to this great community."
tag-6: As a result of budget cuts facing the Irving Independent School District, Citi enhanced its 2011 supply drive with a $20,000 contribution, financial education resources and a partnership with the Las Colinas Chamber of Commerce and the Financial Sense program to deliver hundreds of additional backpacks. Among the more than 9,300 items, Citi donated 2,442 boxes of crayons, 1,300 spiral notebooks, 1,000 three-ring binders, 900 backpacks, 591 packets of pencils, 500 reams of notebook paper, 481 boxes of colored pencils, 330 boxes of markers and 328 packages of pens. In addition, with Citi's commitment to green practices, 800 of the donated binders were recycled, gently used business binders that will benefit both students and teachers.
tag-7: "We are thrilled that Citi chose the Irving Independent School District and Irving School Foundation as the recipient of its school supply drive," said Thelma Cantu, Partners in Education Coordinator for the Irving School Foundation. "Citi is a great partner and community neighbor, and its support of Irving's children represents an incredible gift as they start the school year."
